column1: # Four locations are named on the rainfall sheets; they are close neighbours, if not the same place, and operate sequentially.
# The gauge is initially at Elim Lodge, a private house close to the sea front.
# In July 1911 the gauge location becomes Public Gardens, likely to be the Promenade Gardens next to Elim Lodge.
# In 1921 the gauge location is given as Promenade, which may still be the Gardens or close by.
# From April 1923 the gauge location is Hornsea Urban District Council Town Hall, and a new gauge is in use.
# The Town Hall offices were in the property which used to be called Elim Lodge.
# February-May 1911 are grouped into a single aggregate reading of 4.50 on the sheet.
# January-March 1923 readings appear duplicated on two sheets. They seem to belong to the 'Promenade' sheet.
# No 1923 total is included as readings for the year come from different sheets (and gauges).
# The January and February 1947 figures are identified on the sheet as estimates due to snow and have been retained.
# The station continued until 1972 according to MIDAS.
